result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J Rasmussen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $125 + costs = $610.50 (incl. DNA surcharge), to be paid in $100 per month installments. This payment plan is to begin at the conclusion of Mr. Rasmussen's payments for Court Appointed Attorney fees and be on the same day of months and at the same rate. Non-payment shall result in a 12 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

0 days credit
12-01-2015 The Court orders the defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for Court appointed attorney fees of $281

Case called at 4:00pm [mo]
(Scheduled for STC)
Defendant Tyler J Rasmussen in court with Attorney Teri M. Strohschein.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Rasmussen

The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $125 + costs = $610.50 (incl. DNA surcharge), to be paid in $100 per month installments. This payment plan is to begin at the conclusion of Mr. Rasmussen's payments for Court Appointed Attorney fees and be on the same day of months and at the same rate. Non-payment shall result in a 12 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

[MK] case called at 2:54pm. 
Defendant Tyler J Rasmussen in court.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court grants Mr. Rasmussen's newly-filed Petition for the Appointment of Counsel. The Court requires Mr. Rasmussen to make $100 per month payments toward reimbursement commencing on 9/18/15.  
The Court adjourns the hearing.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance at 08-18-2015 02:00 pm
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 2:55pm. 
Defendant Tyler J Rasmussen in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, the charge and maximum penalties are recited., the reading of the factual portion of the Criminal Complaint is waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
After Mr. Rasmussen indicates that he wishes to have an attorney, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $500 signature bond, with conditions: 
--absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores; the Court makes an exception to this condition that Mr. Ramussen may be at Rookies Bar in Okauchee only during work hours or for mandatory work meetings, and also that Mr. Rasmussen may possess/carry alcohol at Rookies Bar for work-related reasons such as clean-up of the bar
--to take all prescription medications only as prescribed
recess 3:02pm. 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 8/18/15 at 2:00pm.
The Court grants request to adjourn initial appearance
